product_description.product_definition: Portland cement is defined as a hydraulic cement produced by pulverizing clinker, consisting essentially of crystalline hydraulic calcium silicates, and usually containing one or more of the following: water, calcium sulfate, up to 5% limestone, and processing additions.
product_description.product_applicability: Cement is the basic ingredient of concrete. Concrete is formed when Portland cement creates a paste with water that binds with sand and rock to harden.

lca_information.cut_off_criteria: All input/output data required were collected and included in the LCI modelling.
lca_information.data_collection: Gate-to-gate input/output flow data were collected for the following processes for the reference year 2019: Limestone quarry, clinker production and cement manufacture — Joppa, IL.
lca_information.allocation_rules: Recycling and recycled content are modeled using the cut-off rule.

data_quality_requirements.technology_coverage: Data represents the prevailing technology in use at the Joppa, IL facility.
data_quality_requirements.completeness: All relevant, specific processes, including inputs and outputs were considered.
data_quality_requirements.consistency: The LCI modeling of the production input and output LCI data for the Joppa cement products of interest used the same LCI modeling structure.
data_quality_requirements.reproducibility: Internal reproducibility is possible since the data and the models are stored and available in LH Joppa Athena LCI database developed in SimaPro, 2020.

additional_info.environmental_protection_and_equipment: The Holcim Joppa plant operates a Selective Catalytic Reducer (SCR) to help control NOx emissions and Dry Sorbent Injection (DS) for SO2 emissions.
